results.raw: Woman Killed in Cypress Hills Triple Shooting at 3440 Atlantic Ave, Brooklyn, New York, 11208
results.title: Woman Killed in Cypress Hills Triple Shooting

-MVBPlqMxvmNZ6OvjcSJ.text: Police are responding to an unconfirmed report of seven shots heard.

-MVBPltF6RY5Qp7X3Ldl.text: Incident reported at Atlantic Ave & Lincoln Ave.

-MVBQ2AfMN0AA4gy3EAr.text: Police at the scene have requested EMS after finding a person shot.

-MVBQHb-v5LlSZODTNpS.text: The address reported for this incident has changed to 3440 Atlantic Ave.

-MVBR0U-9umwR27j7M0p.text: The address reported for this incident has changed to 3443 Atlantic Ave.

-MVBR9R3tjhSldqNi_xg.text: Police advise that the injured person is a woman.

-MVBRGaFzzFm51aXeRSx.text: The address reported for this incident has changed to 3440 Atlantic Ave.

-MVBRTd-jtQSUTX4G_s0.text: Police advise that there were three suspects, all of whom are men.

-MVBUoFSPd7sbX_RDZHZ.text: Police describe one of the suspects only as a man last seen wearing a purple hat.

-MVBVEZjV-tySRu12-aK.text: Police advise that the first suspect fled Eastbound on Atlantic Avenue on foot.

nib.text:
A woman was killed and two men were injured in a Cypress Hills shooting on Sunday morning, police say. 

At 6:17 a.m. police responded to a report of shots fired near Autumn Avenue and Atlantic Avenue. 

Upon arrival, officers located a 28-year-old woman with a gunshot wound to the abdomen. 

EMS personnel transported the woman to an area hospital, where she was pronounced dead. 

Two additional gunshot victims were later connected with the incident after they were transported to area hospitals by private means. 

A 26-year-old man was shot in the torso and is reportedly in stable condition. 

A 36-year-old man was shot in the leg and is also reportedly in stable condition. 

NYPD officials said no arrests have been made and an investigation is ongoing. 

No suspect information was provided in a statement from officials.

results.raw: Body Discovered in Seaport at 95 South St, New York, 10038
results.title: Body Discovered in Seaport

-MV8_tHqGkfN1nM19RUa.text: Police reported a deceased woman was found wrapped in plastic this morning inside a building.

nib.text:
A deceased woman wrapped in plastic was discovered in Seaport Saturday morning, officials said. 

At approximately 9:20 a.m., police and EMS received a 911 call reporting an unconscious woman was inside 95 South Street. 

Upon arrival, units discovered a 19-year-old woman wrapped in plastic who was pronounced deceased at the scene by EMS. 

The NYPD reported that the Medical Examiner will determine the cause of death.

Detectives are involved in an ongoing investigation. 

Anyone with information about the case can call Crime Stoppers at 800-577-TIPS (for Spanish, dial 888-57-PISTA). You can also submit tips online at nypdcrimestoppers.com, or on Twitter @NYPDTips. All calls and messages are kept confidential.

results.raw: 7-Year-Old Boy In Critical Condition After Being Struck by FDNY Truck at 227 Broad St, Staten Island, New York, 10304
results.rawLocation: 227 Broad St, Staten Island, New York, 10304
results.title: 7-Year-Old Boy In Critical Condition After Being Struck by FDNY Truck

-MV6U_J8B4ibqicR1fJP.text: Firefighters report a pedestrian who was struck by a fire truck.

-MV6UkGZ7nCCNqB15JR0.text: Police and EMS units are en route to the scene.

-MV6YQc-NP97omw3p8Ni.text: The address reported for this incident has changed to 227 Broad St.

-MV6YQkGRdD3DtVGIM38.text: The address reported for this incident has changed to 227 Broad St.

-MV6Z3Kr5-3rqo581fi4.text: Firefighters on scene report that one person is critically injured and is being transported to the hospital via ambulance.

nib.text:
A 7-year-old boy is in critical condition after being struck by a fire truck in Stapleton early Saturday morning, police say.

According to officials, at around 7:25 a.m. police responded to a report of a vehicle collision around 227 Broad street.

EMS responded to the scene and transported a 7-year-old boy to a nearby hospital where he was listed in critical condition. 

Officials say that the fire truck was traveling eastbound on Broad street when it struck the child as he attempted to cross the road in the middle of the block.
 
The FDNY members stopped the truck and rendered aid to the child, who officials say is not considered likely to die from his injuries, which include serious trauma to the head. 

It is currently unclear if the FDNY truck was en route to an emergency call.

The investigation is ongoing and there have been no arrests.
